name: ES2023 S17 - Module A
description: This project involves creating a static, responsive website using only HTML and CSS, based on a client-provided structure and content. It must include four pages, follow accessibility (WCAG) and SEO standards, and work across mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports.

name: ES2023 S17 - Module B
description: This project involves creating a dynamic website using server-side rendering techniques.

name: ES2023 S17 - Module C
description: Create a REST API that provides commercial access to AI services with authentication, quotas, billing, and error handling. Build secure endpoints that wrap ChatterBlast (chat), DreamWeaver (image generation), and MindReader (image recognition) services.

name: ES2023 S17 - Module D
description: Create a modern frontend application using a JavaScript framework to interact with AI services through a REST API. The Single Page Application includes authentication, error handling, and interactive features for chat, image generation, and image recognition services.

name: ES2023 S17 - Module E
description: Advanced web development skills including automated testing, Progressive Web App (PWA) development, and custom Web Components creation. Build comprehensive test suites, create installable PWAs with offline functionality, and develop reusable web components.

name: Taitaja 2025 S17 - Module B
description: The competitor’s task is to build an admin panel for the Hobbly application, which will manage activity announcements and user accounts.

name: WS2024 S17 - Module B
description: We are going to create a management system for an office administrator (as known as "admin") to manage some made-in-France products.

name: Taitaja 2024 S17 - Module B
description: The competitor’s task is to build the Retro Game House Hall of Fame gallery website, showcasing top players and high scores for each game or event.

name: WS2024 S17 - Module C
description: In this project, editors have written articles introducing notable heritage sites in Lyon, France.

name: WS2024 S17 - Module D
description: In this project, you will create a mobile web application that provides access to essential service data for the city of Lyon.

name: EuroSkills 2023 Training HU - Module A
description: Create a captivating promotional website for DineEase, a revolutionary dining platform. Build a responsive HTML/CSS website showcasing restaurant search, featured restaurants, testimonials, and company information to attract new users to the DineEase platform.

name: EuroSkills 2023 Training HU - Module B
description: Develop a server-side rendered administration system for DineEase restaurant owners. Create a comprehensive management hub with user authentication, role-based access control, menu management, reservation handling, and review management capabilities.

name: EuroSkills 2023 Training HU - Module C
description: Create a secure REST API Gateway that provides commercial access to DineEase restaurant services. Build a robust API with authentication, caching, rate limiting, and comprehensive error handling that wraps existing unsecure services into a reliable commercial offering.

name: EuroSkills 2023 Training HU - Module D
description: Create an interactive frontend application for guests utilizing the DineEase restaurant service. Build a modern Single Page Application (SPA) using a JavaScript framework that provides users with an easy-to-navigate platform to explore restaurants, view detailed menus, read past reviews, and place orders.

name: WS2024 S17 - Module E
description: Create an interactive photo slideshow web application that allows users to load, organize, and display photos with multiple animation themes. The application features drag-and-drop functionality, various slideshow modes (manual, auto-playing, random), multiple visual themes with CSS animations, and a command bar for quick navigation and control.

name: WS2024 S17 - Module F
description: Create a comprehensive tourist promotion website for Lyon featuring interactive elements, multimedia content, and advanced web technologies. Includes sticky navigation, call-to-action effects, map attractions, intelligent video playback, text-to-speech, custom web components, progressive web app functionality, and full accessibility compliance.

name: WS2022 S17 - Module C
description: Develop a comprehensive online browser gaming platform backend with Administrator Portal for managing users and games, plus REST API for Developer and Gaming portals. Includes user authentication, game upload functionality, score tracking, and administrative controls for user management and game moderation.

name: WS2022 S17 - Module D
description: Develop a comprehensive frontend for an online browser gaming platform. Create a single-page application that provides user authentication, game discovery with infinite scroll, interactive game playing with score submission, user profile management, and game management functionality for developers. Focus on accessibility, responsive design, and modern frontend development practices.

name: WS2022 S17 - Module E
description: Create an interactive learning game for kids featuring avatar movement, scene switching, and educational quizzes in a virtual world environment.

name: ES2025 TRAINING HU S17 - Module A
description: Create a responsive static website for SkillShare Academy digital learning platform using HTML5 and CSS3.

name: ES2025 TRAINING HU S17 - Module B
displayName: SkillShare Academy - Dynamic Website with Server-Side Rendering
description: Create a server-side rendered administrative interface for SkillShare Academy platform management with role-based access control and OWASP security compliance.

name: ES2025 TRAINING HU S17 - Module C
description: The task is to build a comprehensive REST API for the SkillShare Academy learning platform with authentication, course management, mentor booking, and credit system.

name: ES2025 TRAINING HU S17 - Module D
description: Create a modern frontend application using a JavaScript framework to interact with the SkillShare Academy platform through a REST API. The Single Page Application includes authentication, error handling, and interactive features for course discovery, mentor booking, and credit management.

name: ES2025 S17 - Module A
description: Build a promotional static website using HTML and CSS to promote an offshore wind farm project and attract potential investors.

name: ES2025 S17 - Module B
description: Build a server-side rendered dynamic website for managing an offshore wind farm project with investor management, tour bookings, and admin functions.

name: TS2025 S17 - Module A
description: The task is to build a static website using only HTML and CSS for a bicycle rental company called VelOrda. The website promotes cycling in the city and provides information about available bicycles, pricing plans, and frequently asked questions.

name: ES2025 S17 - Module C
description: Build a secure REST API for offshore wind farm monitoring and control with authentication, role management, alerts, turbine control, and log parsing.

name: TS2025 S17 - Module B
description: Create a server-side rendered admin dashboard for managing a bicycle rental platform. Features include authentication, category and bicycle management, rental conditions, pricing tariffs, booking history with CSV export, moderation applications, and promotional codes. Emphasizes OWASP security, database design (3NF), and professional UI/UX.

name: ES2025 S17 - Module D
description: Offshore Wind Farm Interactive Frontend using an API

name: TS2025 S17 - Module C
description: Build a secure REST API for a bicycle rental platform that integrates with external services for weather, traffic, and OAuth authentication. Features include bicycle rental management with dynamic pricing, user ratings, repair workflows, transaction history tracking, and deposit management. The API must adhere to OpenAPI specifications and implement robust security measures.

name: TS2025 S17 - Module D
description: Build a mobile-first Progressive Web App (PWA) for the VelOrda bicycle rental platform that consumes the REST API from Module C. Features include OAuth authentication, interactive map-based bicycle selection with real-time status updates, dynamic pricing based on weather and traffic conditions, rental management with live cost tracking, user profile with transaction history and balance operations, and work pages for bicycle owners and moderators. The application must support offline capabilities, home screen installation, and real-time data synchronization.

name: ES2021 S17 - Module C
description: Build a RESTful API using PHP for a concert booking system that allows users to view concerts, check seating availability, make reservations, and complete ticket bookings. The API must be implemented exactly as specified, including response formats, header fields, and HTTP status codes, as it will be consumed by both web and mobile applications.

name: ES2021 S17 - Module D
description: Build a single page application (SPA) that consumes a RESTful API to provide a complete concert booking experience. The application enables users to discover concerts with filtering capabilities, book seats with temporary reservations, retrieve tickets, and manage bookings. The frontend must be responsive, accessible (WCAG compliant), and optimized for minimal API traffic. The application will be evaluated using automated Cypress tests and accessibility tools including axe.

name: ES2021 S17 - Module B
displayName: Stars in Graz Music Concert Website
description: Build a responsive one-page website using HTML and CSS to promote a music concert event. Create an MVP landing page that fills the browser viewport, then extend it to a full MMP with navigation, concert schedule, testimonials, and FAQ sections. The website must be responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports, conform to accessibility standards, and pass W3C validation.

name: ES2021 S17 - Module A
description: Build an interactive web tool for arranging VIP seating using drag-and-drop functionality, local storage, and browser APIs. The tool allows officers to swap VIP names in a grid, load VIP lists from various sources (cache, sample data, or external files), toggle fullscreen mode, and export the arranged list in markdown format.

name: ES2025 S17 - Module E
displayName: Advanced Web Development - Testing, Security, and Dark Mode
description: Build comprehensive unit tests for a JavaScript project, identify and document OWASP Top 10 security vulnerabilities, and implement a CSS dark mode toggle with system preference support and persistent user settings.

name: WS2017 S17 - Module EF
description: Build a fully functional web-based space shooter game called Star Battle that works in modern web browsers. The game requires creating design documentation with PNG mockups, implementing a complete HTML/CSS layout with animated instructions screen, and developing interactive JavaScript functionality for spaceship control, enemy combat, fuel collection, and score tracking. The game must implement spaceship movement using hover-activated control areas, shooting mechanics with space bar controls, collision detection for enemies and asteroids, fuel management system with collection mechanics, pause/resume functionality, sound effects integration, accessibility features including font size controls, and a ranking system with server-side score registration using AJAX and PHP. The game must be developed for tablet resolution (960x600 pixels) with centering for larger screens, validate against W3C HTML5 and CSS3 standards, work correctly in Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox, and include proper code organization and documentation.

name: WS2019 S17 - Module D
description: Build an attendee interface for an event management system. The interface enables attendees to browse upcoming events, view event agendas with session details, register for events with ticket selection and workshop enrollment, and manage authentication. Implemented using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with RESTful API integration. The interface requires URL-based state management, error handling, and must follow provided mockups exactly using specified CSS classes and IDs.

name: WS2019 S17 - Module C
description: Build an event management system with a server-side rendered organizer interface and RESTful API for attendees. The system enables organizers to manage events, sessions, channels, rooms, and tickets with multi-tenant security. Key features include database design for event and session ratings, dynamic ticket pricing, room capacity visualization, and a comprehensive REST API for event discovery and registration. Implemented using PHP framework, MySQL, and following third normal form database design principles.

name: WS2019 S17 - Module E
description: Build an interactive presenter web application for Kazan tourism with route editor and view modes. Create interactive presentation routes with linked elements, implement WYSIWYG content editing, directional transition animations, and keyboard navigation. The application features a desktop route editor for creating interactive routes and a responsive view mode for desktop and tablet that displays presentations with smooth transitions. Implemented using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with WCAG 2.0 compliance.

name: WS2019 S17 - Module F
description: Build a responsive one-page marketing website using HTML and CSS promoting the Interactive Presenter service for Kazan tourism. The website includes logo, social media icons, screenshots of editor and viewer modes, interactive 'How it works' section, call-to-action elements, and content sections about service features. Must be responsive across mobile (360×640), tablet (768×1024), and desktop (1440×900) viewports. Implements web design principles, accessibility standards, and W3C validation compliance.

name: WS2022 S17 - Module A
description: Practice a fast-paced set of WorldSkills 2022 Speed Test tasks covering image editing, responsive layout, JavaScript, PHP, and WordPress using original competition-style assets and scoring.

name: WS2024 S17 - Module A
description: Create a set of mini speed Test Projects for Module A (Static Website Design) from WorldSkills 2024, implementing small, self-contained tasks across design implementation, front-end development, and back-end web functionality using the provided media assets and starter code.
